page.title: 16Living in Catthorpe
page.content: Life in the 1980's for most people consists of working outside their community and returning in the evening for the main meal of the day with the rest of the family.This applies to most of the people in Catthorpe. There is a distinct lack of entertainment,so a group has formed called "The Friendly Three" (Catthorpe Swinford and Shawell) which organise shopping trips and social outings for the people of the villages. There is no school in Catthorpe,so the local authority arrange for a bus to take school-age children to Swinford (their nearest school.) The local public house-"The Cherry Tree"- offers limited entertainment for those who are 18+,but youngsters under 18 have to organise their own entertainment at youth clubs etc. in neighbouring villages.
